result.execSummary:
The defendant Jameil A. Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).
  • Intimidate Victim/As a Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(5).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Count 1 is Consecutive to any other sentence.
****AS OF COURT HEARIN ON 3/1/19 PRIOR SENTENCE IMPOSED ON 2/11/15 IS NOW VACATED.  CHARGES ARE ALL REINSTATED - FPT ON 7/18/19 @ 830AM. - JURY TRIAL ON 7/29/19 @ 830AM.****

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.  May not have contact with Megan Slocum, Angelica Correa, their residences, families or places of employment, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kerri Cleghorn.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  DE's motion for new trial.  The court has received correspondence from the DE regarding Atty Cleghorn's representation.  Atty Cleghorn indicates she reviewed the issues that the DE brought up in that correspondence and believes that the DE is now satisfied with her representation; the DE indicates to the court that he is satisfied with Atty Cleghorn's representation.  Attorney Michael Barth sworn in and testimony was given; DE waives Attorney/Client priviledge relating to Atty Barth.  The DE Jameil Garrett was sworn and testimony given.  Attorney Aileen Henry sworn and begins to give testimony; the Court interjects regarding the the DE waiving priviledge relating to Atty Henry; the DE does not waive Atty/Client priviledge relating to Atty Henry.  The court finds that Atty Henry is a credible witness based on the offer of proof given and the minimal testimony she gave; Atty Henry is excused from the stand.  The court finds that Atty Barth testified credibly. The court cannot find that the outcome of the trial would have been different but for the deficiency of counsel and would need testimony from the alibi witnesses.  The court denies the DE's motion for a new trial and will sign an order.  Atty Cleghorn will send an order to the court.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk:PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced as follows:
Count 1 - 10 years in the WSP; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision with conditions.  Count 1 is consecutive to any other sentence.
Count 2 - 4 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions and concurrent to Count 1.
Count 3 - 2 years in the WSP; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision with conditions and concurrent to Count 1.
Count 4 - 2 years in the WSP; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervisionwith conditions and concurrent to Count 1.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

(DAY 2 ) Attorney Margaret Drees and Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
Sworn in and testitifed are State's witnesses: Dr. James Concannon and Heather B. - Physicians Assistant of United Health Systems.  DE advised of his rights and elects not to testify.  State rests at 9:36 AM.  Sworn in and testified is Defense's Witness: Herman J.  Defense rests.  No rebuttal and evidence is closed.  Jury instructions given to the jurors.  Closing arguments made.  Jury begins deliberation at 10:38 AM.    Verdict reached at 1:30 PM. Jury finds defendant Guilty on all 4 counts.  Jury polled and released at 1:45 AM.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Court grants state's motion and DE is adjudged guilty on both counts. PSI ordered for Sentencing on 6/25/15 at 11:00 AM.  Bond is revoked.

Attorneys Margaret Drees and Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Barth.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Motions in limine heard and decided by the Court.  Voir dire began at 9:11 a.m.; ended at 10:22 a.m.  13 jurors selected.  Opening instructions by the Court and opening statements by counsel made.  Angelica C. testified on behalf of the State.  During witness's testimony, the Court excused a juror on the Court's own motion (11:25 a.m.).  Trial proceeds with 12 jurors.  Megan S. testified on behalf of the State.  Break for lunch at 11:59 a.m.
Clerk: PT - Sworn in and testified are State's witnesses: KPD Officer J. Olson, KPD Detective K. Duffy and Brian S.  Exhibits 1, 3 and 5 through 17 offered and received.  Court breaks for the day and jurors are instructed to return at 8:15 AM.
